translation: They’re blemished, climbed, and gone beyond the stream. There’s no such thing as:

source_sentence: atthaṅgato so uda vā so natthi.
translation: They’ve come to an end, there is no water,

source_sentence: **Udāhu ve sassatiyā arogo**ti udāhu nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṁ tatheva tiṭṭheyyāti—
translation: or is it permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever?
Or is it possible to gourd
Please explain this to me, O sage,

source_sentence: **Tan**ti yaṁ pucchāmi yaṁ yācāmi yaṁ ajjhesāmi yaṁ pasādemi.
translation: I ask you about what I ask, since I ask, what I have come to.

source_sentence: **Munī**ti monaṁ vuccati ñāṇaṁ …pe… saṅgajālamaticca so muni.
translation: peacocks, is said to be the sage gone beyond suffering, he does not completely understand the origin of the world.

source_sentence: **Sādhu viyākarohī**ti sādhu ācikkhāhi desehi paññapehi paṭṭhapehi vivarāhi vibhajāhi uttānīkarohi pakāsehīti—
translation: It would be good if he explains, teaches, asserts, establishes, clarifies, analyzes, and reveals it.
Please explain this to me, O sage,

source_sentence: **Tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo**ti tathā hi te vidito tulito tīrito vibhūto vibhāvito esa dhammoti—
translation: for this Teaching has been understood by you. It is for your reputation: “This Dhamma is such that it is your state, illness, and attainment.”

source_sentence: tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.
translation: for this Teaching has been understood by you.
The brahmin replied,
“There is no strike or filler,
Or is it possible to gourd
Please explain this to me, O sage,

source_sentence: Tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo”ti.
translation: for this Teaching has been understood by you.”
Wealth has no wavering.
he is qualified.
by which one might have no fault,
when everything has been completely removed,
All the disputes are eradicated,

source_sentence: **Atthaṅgatassa na pamāṇamatthī**ti atthaṅgatassa anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbutassa rūpapamāṇaṁ natthi, vedanāpamāṇaṁ natthi, saññāpamāṇaṁ natthi, saṅkhārapamāṇaṁ natthi, viññāṇapamāṇaṁ natthi, na atthi na saṁvijjati nupalabbhati pahīnaṁ samucchinnaṁ vūpasantaṁ paṭippassaddhaṁ abhabbuppattikaṁ ñāṇagginā daḍḍhanti—
translation: and there is no such thing as beauty.
Wealth has no wavering.

source_sentence: **Upasīvāti bhagavā**ti **upasīvā**ti bhagavā taṁ brāhmaṇaṁ nāmena ālapati.
translation: Upasīva, the Buddha, Ānanda, drew near the brahmin,
“It’s terminator ...”
he is qualified.

source_sentence: **Yena naṁ vajjuṁ taṁ tassa natthī**ti yena taṁ rāgena vadeyyuṁ, yena dosena vadeyyuṁ, yena mohena vadeyyuṁ, yena mānena vadeyyuṁ, yāya diṭṭhiyā vadeyyuṁ, yena uddhaccena vadeyyuṁ, yāya vicikicchāya vadeyyuṁ, yehi anusayehi vadeyyuṁ—
translation: They’d say what the Vajjis don’t say. Those who misrepresent him with what is false and have said. They would be doing any doubtful, would there be for that reasoned.

source_sentence: rattoti vā duṭṭhoti vā mūḷhoti vā vinibaddhoti vā parāmaṭṭhoti vā vikkhepagatoti vā aniṭṭhaṅgatoti vā thāmagatoti vā, te abhisaṅkhārā pahīnā.
translation: or for annoying: he is confused about what has been seen, what is distributed, what is distributed, what is left over, or has come to be.

source_sentence: Abhisaṅkhārānaṁ pahīnattā gatiyā yena taṁ vadeyyuṁ—
translation: But if they were given up, they would say,

source_sentence: nerayikoti vā tiracchānayonikoti vā pettivisayikoti vā manussoti vā devoti vā rūpīti vā arūpīti vā saññīti vā asaññīti vā nevasaññīnāsaññīti vā, so hetu natthi paccayo natthi kāraṇaṁ natthi yena vadeyyuṁ katheyyuṁ bhaṇeyyuṁ dīpeyyuṁ vohareyyunti—
translation: They wouldn’t perceive animals as animals,” “Your intentions,” “It’s a reason why non-percipient or non-humans these things. There’s no reason for you, there’s no reason or reason for anyone else.

source_sentence: yena naṁ vajjuṁ taṁ tassa natthi.
translation: by which one might have no fault,

source_sentence: **Sabbesu dhammesu samūhatesū**ti sabbesu dhammesu sabbesu khandhesu sabbesu āyatanesu sabbāsu dhātūsu sabbāsu gatīsu sabbāsu upapattīsu sabbāsu paṭisandhīsu sabbesu bhavesu sabbesu saṁsāresu sabbesu vaṭṭesu ūhatesu samūhatesu uddhatesu samuddhatesu uppāṭitesu samuppāṭitesu pahīnesu samucchinnesu vūpasantesu paṭippassaddhesu abhabbuppattikesu ñāṇagginā daḍḍhesūti—
translation: when all things are given up: among all things, as all the aggregates, dominar, aggregates, and classed as they are, all exists in the four contemplations of existence. They are given up in them, all these things rooted in the various orders of rebirths, old age, and death.
when everything has been completely removed,

source_sentence: **Samūhatā vādapathāpi sabbe**ti vādapathā vuccanti kilesā ca khandhā ca abhisaṅkhārā ca.
translation: All the advices are so called defilements and defilement, etc., and the aggregates are their defilement and their defilements.

source_sentence: Tassa vādā ca vādapathā ca adhivacanāni ca adhivacanapathā ca nirutti ca niruttipathā ca paññatti ca paññattipathā ca ūhatā samūhatā uddhatā samuddhatā uppāṭitā samuppāṭitā pahīnā samucchinnā vūpasantā paṭippassaddhā abhabbuppattikā ñāṇagginā daḍḍhāti—
translation: The ground is dispelled, terminated, deplayed, and perishing, the language of the terminology, and the path of the language beginning. They’ve abandoned the influence of usage and the language beginning, middle and end of the language.
All the disputes are eradicated,
The Buddha replied,
“There is no wavering in going,
he is qualified.

source_sentence: Yena naṁ vajjuṁ taṁ tassa natthi;
translation: by which one might have no fault,
when everything has been completely removed,
and all the way of speaking the path.”

source_sentence: Saha gāthāpariyosānā ye te brāhmaṇena saddhiṁ …pe…
translation: together with the assembly of brahmins ...
was sitting there circumambulating the one with joined palms:
you’re my teacher, I’m your disciple.
The sixth question to Sīvaṇa .
